feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays, which are subtracted from the total working days to determine the accurate deduction amount. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates and reflects the corresponding pay deduction on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control over calculation methodology.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods.
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, enabling Super Admins to configure deduction calculations when adding new leave policies
To adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement.

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings.

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Selecting Unpaid leave option
Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation to access salary proration configuration.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be configured to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
Super admin role and access to payroll settings are required to use the Daily Wage Calculator.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add or modify leave policies
Super admin role required to access and modify salary proration settings.

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days in the month (if using calendar day policy), and the dates of public holidays falling in the month.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deductions
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days.

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and the deduction reflected on the payroll table.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine how daily deductions are applied to employee monthly pay
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method, affecting first salary and end-of-service settlement amounts.

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Access Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select the required calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy determines whether calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) are used. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to arrive at actual working days.

Three calculation bases are available: calendar days (number of days in the given month), working days (business days only, excluding weekends and public holidays), and custom days (flexible configuration per company policy). Most UAE and KSA companies set custom days as 30 to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are restricted to Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies to eligible paid leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; day calculation types are limited to Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working days total when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calendar days calculation varies by month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), and different calculation bases can significantly impact final wage calculations. Selection of calculation base and salary components directly affects salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration, allowing them to review potential impacts before finalizing settings.
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policies

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject existing prorated salary transactions before saving new proration settings to ensure changes take effect.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, the company's public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service payroll processing.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; integrates with Leave Policies configuration and Leave Settings
Interacts with the Payroll system and Daily Wage Calculator (DWC) module; affects active payroll table transactions and employee salary calculations.

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Working days: The number of business days in a month, excluding weekends and public holidays. Calendar days: The total number of days in a month (e.g., 30 days) used as the basis for leave calculation under calendar day-based leave policies. Public holidays: Days designated as holidays that are subtracted from working days when calculating daily pay.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly set to 30 in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final payroll settlement when an employee exits the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that does not receive compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of determining deduction amount based on daily wage; Leave encashment: Similar process for calculating leave-related payments; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): The payroll configuration module where salary proration settings are managed. Salary Proration: The proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: The three methods available for proration—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
